alert.note: Alert for Coos (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 4:15AM PST until January 29 at 11:43PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Medford OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting Coos County. For the Coquille River...including Coquille...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, The Coquille River is at flood stage. Expect flooding of farmland and low-lying areas throughout the flood plain along the Coquille River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM PST Sunday the stage was 20.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will continue to rise through the day with a maximum value of 21.3 feet late this evening, before gradually decreasing Monday. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.2 feet on 02/08/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 415 PM PST.
